2.text: Thinkest thou this to be right, that thou saidst, My righteousness is more than Godâ€™s?

3.text: For thou hast asked of what profit it is unto thee: what do I gain more than if I had sinned?

4.text: I will reply to thee in words, and to thy companions with thee.

5.text: Look unto the heavens and see; and survey the skies: they are higher than thou.

6.text: If thou sinnest, what doest thou against him? If thy transgressions be multiplied, what doest thou unto him?

7.text: If thou be righteous, what givest thou to him? or what doth he receive of thy hand?

8.text: Thy wickedness [may affect] a man as thou [art], and thy righteousness a son of man.

9.text: By reason of the multitude of oppressions they cry; they cry out by reason of the arm of the mighty:

10.text: But none saith, Where is +God my Maker, who giveth songs in the night,

11.text: Who teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth, and maketh us wiser than the fowl of the heavens?

12.text: There they cry, and he answereth not, because of the pride of evil men.

13.text: Surely God will not hear vanity, neither will the Almighty regard it.

14.text: Although thou sayest thou dost not see him, judgment is before him, therefore wait for him.

15.text: But now, because he hath not visited in his anger, doth not [Job] know [his] great arrogancy?

16.text: For Job hath opened his mouth in vanity, and made words abundant without knowledge.
